prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3867, 0.0] Next, create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1) and a loop (loop_1) that encloses the shape. The loop consists of the following linear and circular elements: - line_1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0117] - line_3: Starting at [0.75, 0.0117] and ending at [0.0, 0.0117] - line_4: Starting at [0.0, 0.0117] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] After the 2D sketch is completed, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal to create the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.3867 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0 - sketch_scale: 0.75 The resulting shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of the sides are equal (0.3867 in width and 0.75 in length), and the height is half the width (0.3867 / 2 = 0.1933 in height). Final Shape: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Create a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel, and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal, and the height is half the width. prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the Base Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole running through its center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and is slightly taller than it is wide. The cylindrical hole is also cylindrical in shape, slightly shorter than the prism, and centered on the x-axis. The final shape will be made of a solid material. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.375] Sketching the Base Create the base of the part by sketching on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. This base will have three faces (face_1, face_2, and face_3). Face 1 Begin with the smaller arc at the top left of the base (arc_1). The properties of arc_1 are as follows: - Start Point: [0.0569, 0.0] - Mid Point: [0.0, 0.0569] - End Point: [0.0569, 0.1138] Next, create a line (line_1) below the arc which connects the endpoints of the arc. - Start Point: [0.0569, 0.1138] - End Point: [0.0569, 0.0] Face 2 Now, create a continuous loop on the right side of the part that aligns with the X-axis. Start with a line (line_1) from the endpoint of the previous line/arc on face_1 to the right side of the base on the X-axis. - Start Point: [0.0569, 0.0] - End Point: [0.2555, 0.0] Next, create another horizontal line (line_2) along the X-axis from the previous endpoint to slightly further right. - Start Point: [0.2555, 0.0] - End Point: [0.2555, 0.1138] Now, draw a line (line_3) from the endpoint of line_2 to the Y-axis, connecting to the end of the arc from face_1. - Start Point: [0.2555, 0.1138] - End Point: [0.0569, 0.1138] Close the loop by connecting the endpoint of line_3 (top right corner) back to the starting point of line_1 (bottom right corner). - Start Point: [0.2555, 0.1138] - End Point: [0.2555, 0.0] Face 3 Finally, create a loop on the top right corner of the base (face_3), adjacent to the first arc (arc_1). Start with a clockwise arc (arc_1) at the top right corner with a similar radius as arc_1. - Start Point: [0.2555, 0.0] - Mid Point: [0.3124, 0.0569] - End Point: [0.2555, 0.1138] Then, draw a linear segment (line_1) that connects the endpoint of the arc to the starting point. - Start Point: [0.2555, 0.1138] - End Point: [0.2555, 0.0] Extruding the Base Extrude the sketch to create the base of the rectangular prism. - Extrude the depth towards the normal: 0.1875 - Extrude the depth in the opposite direction of the normals: 0.1875 - Scale the sketch uniformly: 0.3124 - Operation: New Body Feature Operation</description>
